intro: Stachys spreitzenhoferi subsp. spreitzenhoferi, commonly known as the Spreitzenhofer's hedge-nettle, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in whorls along the stem. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
